entry.def: Suburban means relating to a suburb.

entry.tran: 平淡乏味的;呆板的;传统的
entry.def: If you describe something as suburban, you mean that it is dull and conventional.

example.ex: His clothes are conservative and suburban.

example.tran: 令人厌恶的高级品位和无聊呆板的绅士风度

means.word_mean: 1. relating to or characteristic of or situated in suburbs;

auth_sentence.content: Well, obviously, it's a suburban neighborhood.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Well, obviously, it's a suburban neighborhood.

auth_sentence.content: He expected a businessman or a stylish suburban wife.
auth_sentence.res_content: He expected a businessman or a stylish suburban wife.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He expected a businessman or a stylish suburban wife.

auth_sentence.content: Elizabeth despised Ann's houseproudness as deeply suburban.
auth_sentence.res_content: Elizabeth despised Ann's houseproudness as deeply suburban.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Elizabeth despised Ann's houseproudness as deeply suburban.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词和形容词,"……地方,……人或动物等"; 2. ……的

stems_affixes.word_buile: Americ美国,美洲+an……地方,……人或动物等→adj.美洲的 n.美国人
republic共和国+an……地方,……人或动物等→adj.共和的
Rom+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.古罗马人 adj.罗马的
ruffi=brutal残忍的,兽性的+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.恶棍,歹徒 adj.残暴的
sub下面+urban城市的→城市下面→城市之外的→郊区的
urb城市+an表示地方→adj.城市的,市内的
veter+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.老兵,老手;老兵的; adj.经验丰富的
Americ美国,美洲+an……地方,……人或动物等→adj.美洲的 n.美国人
amphi两个,两种+bi生命+an……地方,……人或动物等→两个生命→两栖动物
parti=party党,一部分人+s+an人→党人→党徒
Rom+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.古罗马人 adj.罗马的
ruffi=brutal残忍的,兽性的+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.恶棍,歹徒 adj.残暴的
Spart斯巴达+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.斯巴达人
veter+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.老兵,老手;老兵的; adj.经验丰富的

Sentence.sentence: Fifty years ago, they were the latest thing in educational reform: big, modern, suburban high schools with students counted in the thousands.

And most noticeable of all, there is the phenomenon of large urban and suburban high schools that have split up into smaller units of a few hundred, generally housed in the same grounds that once boasted thousands of students all marching to the same band.
Suburban high schools were established in the hope of increasing economic efficiency.
Meg is a lawyer-mom in suburban Washington, D.C., where lawyer-moms are thick on the ground.
In America, white tailed deer are more numerous than ever before, so abundant in fact that they've become a suburban nuisance and a health hazard.
They would also terrorize and kill dogs and cats which is not what the suburban dwellers have in mind
